channel.title: Dr. Brittany E. Miles
channel.description: Recent content on Dr. Brittany E. Miles

item.title: Course Title 2
item.description: This undergraduate course presents many new things.

Research Opportunities I am looking for graduate students and postdocs to join my research group. If you are interested in collaborating or pursuing research within my research group email me at bemiles@arizona.edu .

About I grew up in the Los Angeles area and love my family dearly. I stayed in LA County to complete my bachelor’s in Physics and minor in Geophysics and Planetary Physics at UCLA. After undergrad I moved to Santa Cruz to complete my master’s and doctorate in Astronomy and Astrophysics. During this time I got over my fear of the water and learned how to swim, eventually gaining the courage of get out on the ocean on a surfboard.

Group Members Undergraduates Rebekah Boisvert (2025 - ) NASA Space Grant Undergraduate Researcher Ruben Huerta (2025 - ) “Assessing the Seek Thermal Mosaic Core for Ground-Based Astronomy” Ella Butler (Summer 2025) “Using Atmospheric Models for the TEMPO Exposure Time Calculator” Animesh Garg (2023 - 2025) “Jupiter as an Exoplanet seen by HST”

item.title: A 1 to 20 μm Spectrum of VHS 1256–1257 b

item.title: Disequilibrium CO Chemistry in the Coldest Brown Dwarfs
item.description: Bridging the gap between chemistry in the coldest brown dwarfs and Solar System gas giant planets.
